story.storybody:
If only summer hair were just as easy and fuss free as in the advertisements. The reality is we all struggle with frizzy, greasy, brittle strands that are damaged--more so in the sun. Sure, they have seen healthier days, but the annoying summer-related worries do not tend to stop.

Fortunately, there are easy and natural ways to tame your tresses like a pro. Here are five hair problems you're likely to encounter in the hot months and we tell you exactly how you can fix them.

Also read: 4 reasons for you to eat more sweet corn this summer

We contacted Mr Thirumal Raj, CEO and Founder ABC Clinic, Chennai, and asked him to share a few hair hacks for the season. This is what he suggested.

{funfacts}
  1. Deep conditioning with okra or lady finger to get rid of dandruff: Okra helps in getting rid of the dandruff apart from that it also enhances the overall condition of the scalp. Take 4-5 okras and cut them into small pieces, put them in a bowl and fill it with water and leave it over night. The gooey liquid when applied on the scalp can be used to prevent dandruff.
  2. Use aloe vera to get smooth and soft hair: Aloe vera gel (fresh or packaged) can be used as a hair serum to dry and unruly hair.
  3. Hot oil massage for textured hair: Giving hot oil massage to the scalp on a regular basis is a very good tip to dump the dirt and give way to healthy hair.
  4. Regular hair wash to do away with dirt and other pollutants: Pollution and dust combined with sweat tend to accumulate on the scalp, which results in hair fall. Choose a shampoo that removes the right amount of oil from your scalp and wash your hair frequently with a mild shampoo. Also, don't forget to go in for a good conditioner after the shampoo to stop your hair from splitting and drying out.
  5. Proper diet to cure hair loss: Your diet determines the growth of your hair. So, it is advisable to consume healthy foods such as green leafy vegetables, salads and fresh fruits to improve the condition of your hair in the summer season.
{funfacts}

Raj also shared when you must visit a doctor for managing serious hair issues.

Here's when you should see a doctor: If your dandruff fails to go with the shampoos or if the scales of your scalp are oilier or are stuck on; you could be suffering from an underlying medical disease causing dandruff. Consult a dermatologist for proper evaluation and diagnosis of the condition. A doctor normally prescribes a medicated shampoo and few treatments for effective  hair loss problems.

Also read: You are exposed to harmful chemicals and your hair and nails can reveal this

Listed below are two such medical treatments that you may want to choose for treating your hair-loss woes.

Laser hair therapy: Laser therapy treatment helps to increase healthy hair by 73 per cent with no side-effects. This therapy comprises of a hair mask which is combined with patented cold light sources and pure oxygen. This laser light penetrates through your scalp and leaves you with healthy, happy strands. The treatment is said to be extremely effective when it comes to treating hair loss.  

PRP treatment (Platelet Rich Plasma Plus): PRP contains special cells called platelets, that can theoretically cause growth of the hair follicles by stimulating the stem cells and other cells in the microenvironment of the hair follicle. The primary purpose of using PRP in hair restoration is to stimulate inactive or newly implanted hair follicles into an active growth phase. PRP plus is again a holistic approach towards initial non-surgical hair restoration.
